intro: Flueggea meineckia, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 feet tall, characterized by its rough, fissured bark and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
